messages.message: We can check around for performance optimisations in the frontend side.  Can we setup a CDN for AI Hub prod? There are JS files as big as 2.5MB, whose download times in India could be slower as the clusters are setup in US region. This could be a quick fix for the workshops.
Yeah should be fine to setup a CDN. Also curious you would also need to update the JS file on every release?

Yes, JS files would be updated on every release. Image build timestamp is prefixed to all static assets (_refer to the `v=#timestamp`_ in the screenshot), so that these files are cached in the browser for every release. New release will have a different timestamp which clear the browser cache.
we can analyze the bundle sizes, its possible the build process is bundling unnecessary things
plus, if we're keeping aihub in its own subdomain, its possible we can build it without using the shared bundle?
